content.body:
> <@smaug:mozilla.org> I was just looking at some helper page for someone not so familiar with various specs.

https://w3c.github.io/mdn-spec-links/ is the closest thing I have this point â€” as far as whatâ€™s up-to-date and actively maintained

â€¦however that page doesnâ€™t currently/yet have links to the specs themselves â€”Â but I can add that

Unlike https://platform.html5.org/ it doesnâ€™t organize the specs into any category groupings â€” and I really have no plans to ever make it do that.

But the nature of it is, it represents the set of specs that we actually have some documentation for in MDN. So itâ€™s fairly complete as far as representing what specs constitute the feature set for the web platform.

content.body: OK, some Dreamhost issue. I forget now how we have that set up but I think the DNS is through Dreamhost with a CNAME or whatever, and the actual content is served from where all the whatwg.org content is served from
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: OK, some Dreamhost issue. I forget now how we have that set up but I think the DNS is through Dreamhost with a CNAME or whatever, and the actual content is served from where all the whatwg.org content is served from

content.body: The idea is roughly to show some part of the problem space for someone who is coming outside the web platform world. Having a list of specs may give a relatively good hint how vastly different APIs and features we're dealing with.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: The idea is roughly to show some part of the problem space for someone who is coming outside the web platform world. Having a list of specs may give a relatively good hint how vastly different APIs and features we're dealing with.

content.body:
it will take me a while to figure out why https://platform.html5.org/ isnâ€™t responding â€” but in the meantime I can at least get the spec URLs added to https://w3c.github.io/mdn-spec-links/

that I think I can do right now
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text:
it will take me a while to figure out why https://platform.html5.org/ isnâ€™t responding â€” but in the meantime I can at least get the spec URLs added to https://w3c.github.io/mdn-spec-links/

content.body:
smaug: https://w3c.github.io/mdn-spec-links/ now has all the spec URLs

Thatâ€™s the best I can do for now.

Eventually I may be able to replicate https://platform.html5.org/ by writing something that creates an alternative view with them grouped into categories. But that will take quite a lot more time than just adding the spec URLs did.

Anyway, it seems like this list does meet the needs of giving a hint about the vastly different APIs and features we're dealing with. Itâ€™s close to 300 specs nowâ€¦

content.body:
hmm I just thought of one other piece of data I could add that might be useful: I can add a number indicating the how many times MDN articles reference each spec.

So, for example, itâ€™ll show that the Accelerometer spec is referenced by 10 MDN articles whereas the HTML spec is referenced by 1087

content.body:
OK https://w3c.github.io/mdn-spec-links/ now shows the MDN-article counts

That seems useful for getting a quick sense of the relative importance of each spec.
